0.title: CBI arrests TMC leader in chit fund case, recovers ₹80 lakh: Reports
0.article_body: The CBI arrested Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader and Halisahar Municipality Chairman Raju Sahani on Friday in a chit fund scam case registered in Kolkata in 2018. The agency recovered ₹80 lakh in cash, a firearm with live cartridges and documents of properties worth ₹2.75 crore, reports said. Sahani is accused of misappropriating funds of a company called Sunmarg Welfare Organisation.

1.title: Delay in sorting out public complaints will not be tolerated: CM Yogi
1.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has said that any delay in addressing the complaints of the public would not be tolerated. During his visit to review various developmental projects in Balrampur, CM Yogi instructed the officials to take concrete action against criminals under the zero-tolerance policy. Notably, CM Yogi also offered prayers at the Devipatan Shaktipeeth temple in Tulsipur.

2.title: 'Uncertain' whether TMC govt will continue till Dec: BJP's Dilip Ghosh
2.article_body: West Bengal BJP leader Dilip Ghosh on Friday claimed that it's "uncertain" whether the TMC government will continue till December. There could be another Assembly poll by the end of this year, Ghosh said. "Those BJP MLAs who have defected to TMC might come back to the saffron camp along with some more MLAs as interest," Ghosh added.

3.title: Indian High Commissioner to Sri Lanka calls on Prez Wickremesinghe
3.article_body: Indian High Commissioner to Sri Lanka Gopal Baglay visited the country's President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Friday to discuss ways to strengthen bilateral ties. Baglay also gifted a statue of Maitri Buddha to Wickremesinghe. "They reviewed all-round bilateral cooperation and agreed to further strengthen close India-Sri Lanka ties in all spheres," the High Commission of India in Colombo tweeted.

4.title: Pakistan record their biggest-ever T20I win after dismissing Hong Kong for 38
4.article_body: Pakistan recorded their biggest-ever victory in T20I cricket by registering a 155-run win against Hong Kong. Pakistan set up a total of 193/2 before dismissing Hong Kong for 38 runs, the lowest-ever T20I total in the history of Asia Cup. It is also Hong Kong's lowest-ever T20I total. Pakistan have qualified for the Super 4 stage of Asia Cup 2022.

5.title: BSF develops tear gas shell-dropping drone system for security forces
5.article_body: A tear gas shell-dropping drone system has been developed by the Border Security Force (BSF) that can be used by police to control protesters and rioters, a senior officer said on Friday. According to the officer, the system "will be a potential force multiplier for the security forces working in the law-and-order management domain".

6.title: We do & don't brag: Assam CM Himanta Sarma tweets to Kejriwal
6.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma tagged Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal in a tweet on Friday writing about the development work in education sector in the state and stated, "We do and don't brag." He wrote, "Despite being small...compared to Delhi, Assam constructing 21 state-of-art medical colleges/hospitals: 06 completed; 03 to be completed this year, rest in different stages of completion."

7.title: 18 killed, including pro-Taliban cleric, in Afghan mosque blast
7.article_body: At least 18 people were killed and 23 were injured after an explosion ripped through a crowded mosque in west Afghanistan's Herat city on Friday, Taliban officials said. The bomb exploded during the noon prayers at the Guzargah Mosque. Videos showed the mosque's courtyard littered with bodies. The deceased included a senior cleric close to the Taliban.

8.title: It's one of the most challenging roles I've played: Mouni on Brahmastra
8.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy, while speaking about her role in the upcoming movie 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva', said, "It's one of the most challenging roles that I have ever played." "It is Ayan's (director) brainchild," she added. "It is the most interesting role I have gotten to play, till date," said Mouni, who will play the antagonist in the film.

9.title: Nadal is a big favourite also at US Open: Defending champion Medvedev
9.article_body: On being asked if he felt he was the favourite to retain the men's singles title at US Open 2022, defending champion Daniil Medvedev said, "I don't want to put pressure on anybody, but I think Rafael Nadal is a big favourite also." He added, "He won...last time he played here against me actually. He won two slams this year."

10.title: Judge found hanging at his official residence in Odisha's Cuttack
10.article_body: The body of a special POCSO judge was found hanging at his official residence in Odisha's Cuttack on Friday, police said. The deceased has been identified as 49-year-old Subash Kumar Behari. According to police, prima facie it appears to be a case of death by suicide. The incident occurred when Behari's wife and children were not at home, police added.

11.title: Smuggling of drugs from across border is on the rise: J&K DGP
11.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Director General of Police Dilbag Singh on Friday said smuggling of drugs from across the border is on the rise and Pakistan is using it to fund militancy in Kashmir. "People have to fight this strongly as many youths are falling prey to drugs," Singh said. Infiltration along the Line of Control has come down, he added.

12.title: Difficult to imagine he's not here: Shefali on Sidharth's death anniversary
12.article_body: Remembering late actor Sidharth Shukla on his first death anniversary, actress Shefali Jariwala said, "It's very difficult to imagine that he is not here." "Sometimes I go blank just thinking about it, because I still haven't come to terms with it," she added. Calling Sidharth a fun-loving, dynamic, charming and large-hearted person, Shefali said he loved his friends a lot.

13.title: Won't bow my head before BJP: Abhishek Banerjee after ED appearance
13.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew and TMC leader Abhishek Banerjee on Friday said, "[I will] not bow my head before the BJP." This comes after Enforcement Directorate (ED) interrogated him in the alleged coal pilferage scam. "I've attacked...[Amit Shah's son] over the national flag issue but that does not mean the ED...can be used to threaten me," Abhishek added.

14.title: TN CM to hand over Tricolour to Rahul ahead of Bharat Jodo Yatra
14.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will participate in an event in Tamil Nadu's Kanniyakumari where CM MK Stalin will hand him the national flag ahead of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', PTI reported. Rahul is set to undertake the 3,570-km 'padayatra' from Kanniyakumari to Srinagar on September 8. Rahul will reportedly attend a prayer meeting for his father, former PM Rajiv Gandhi.

15.title: Maharashtra cabinet expansion 'soon': BJP's Sudhir Mungantiwar
15.article_body: Maharashtra minister and BJP leader Sudhir Mungantiwar on Friday said an expansion of the state cabinet is expected to take place "soon" to fill up existing vacancies. "We recently formed government and inducted 20 ministers, including CM and Deputy CM," Mungantiwar said. "According to norms, Maharashtra can have 43 ministers. There can be 23 more ministers in the...government," he added.

16.title: China's Shenzhou-14 astronauts successfully complete 6-hour spacewalk
16.article_body: Astronauts Chen Dong and Liu Yang on board China's Tiangong space station on the six-month Shenzhou-14 mission successfully completed a six-hour spacewalk on Friday. The duo installed external parts to the module and tested its functions with another astronaut coordinating from inside. China has landed a rover on Mars and sent probes to the Moon under its space programme.

17.title: Lightning strikes kill 3, injure 2 in separate incidents in UP
17.article_body: Three people were killed and two others were injured in separate incidents of lightning strike in UP on Friday. In Mirzapur district, four people who had taken shelter under a tree were struck by lightning, police said. Two of them later succumbed to their injuries. Meanwhile, a lightning strike claimed the life of a farmer in Raebareli district, police informed.

18.title: 2 IAEA inspectors to stay at Zaporizhzhia plant permanently: Russia
18.article_body: Two inspectors from the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) will be permanently posted at the Russian-controlled Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant in Ukraine, a Russian diplomat told media on Friday. A delegation of IAEA inspectors visited the plant on Thursday to assess damage to "physical integrity" of the facility. Notably, the plant has come under repeated shelling in the recent weeks.

19.title: Bairstow ruled out of T20 WC hours after being named in squad, ECB cites 'freak accident'
19.article_body: England wicketkeeper-batter Jonny Bairstow has been ruled out of T20 World Cup 2022, hours after England announced the squad. "Bairstow sustained a lower limb injury in a freak accident whilst playing golf on Friday in Leeds. He will see a specialist next week to ascertain the full extent of the injury," the England and Wales Cricket Board stated.

20.title: Female employees to get 60-day leave in case of child's death soon after birth: Centre
20.article_body: All female central government employees will be entitled for 60 days special maternity leave in case of death of a child soon after birth, the Department of Personnel and Training (DoPT) said. The decision has been taken keeping in view the "potential emotional trauma" caused due to stillbirth or death of a child soon after birth, the department stated.

21.title: The confidence Suryakumar showed while hitting big shots was superb: Afridi
21.article_body: After Indian batter Suryakumar Yadav scored 68*(26) against Hong Kong, former Pakistan skipper Shahid Afridi said that the confidence showed by the cricketer while "hitting" big shots "was superb". "I sat to watch Virat [Kohli's] batting...but when Suryakumar came in...he hit his first ball for four, then the second ball...and came in with a licence to attack everything," Afridi said.

22.title: Centre distributing jumlas: Priyanka on unemployment suicides
22.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra tweeted on reports stating a rise in suicide deaths due to unemployment and asked "how long" the Centre was going to "distribute jumlas (false promises)". Priyanka's tweet claimed a 26% rise in suicide deaths due to unemployment in 2021 than 2020. She added that the government didn't have a cure or answer.

23.title: Who are the Indian-origin CEOs of some of the world's largest companies?
23.article_body: Laxman Narasimhan has been named the next CEO of Starbucks. Chanel, in December, named Leena Nair as its global CEO. Twitter named Parag Agrawal as its CEO in November. Sandeep Kataria became the first Indian to hold the post of Bata's global CEO. Sundar Pichai became Google CEO in 2015, while Satya Nadella was named Microsoft CEO in 2014.

24.title: Suryakumar has the ability to bat through any situation: Nehra
24.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said India batter Suryakumar Yadav has the ability to bat through any situation. "No matter whichever position you play Suryakumar, he'll remain crucial for India. He has done well wherever he has batted," he added. Suryakumar was adjudged 'Player of the Match' against Hong Kong at Asia Cup 2022. Batting at number four, he scored 68*(26).

25.title: Something major could happen: BJP leader as Abhishek Banerjee questioned
25.article_body: West Bengal BJP President Sukanta Majumdar said "something major" could happen in the ED investigation into TMC's Abhishek Banerjee over the alleged coal scam. "Congress and CPI(M) leaders will swallow their own allegations that the BJP and TMC are in an understanding," said Majumdar. The TMC said this was an admission that there is collusion between BJP and ED.

26.title: Ranveer, Vicky dance to Moosewala's song after Filmfare wins, video viral
26.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing Ranveer Singh and Vicky Kaushal celebrating after winning Best Actor and Best Actor (Critics') respectively at 67th Filmfare Awards. In the video that has gone viral on social media, the actors could be seen dancing to Sidhu Moosewala's song 'Gabru'. While Ranveer won the award for '83', Vicky bagged the award for 'Sardar Udham'.

27.title: Massive fire breaks out at Haryana market; 130 shops damaged
27.article_body: About 130 shops at the Rehri Market in Haryana's Panchkula sustained damages after a massive fire broke out in the area, fire department officials said on Friday. As many as 15 fire tenders were deployed to extinguish the fire, which caused extensive loss to goods inside the shops, according to an official. No casualties were reported in the incident.

28.title: Australia to accept nearly 2 lakh permanent migrants, cap raised for 1st time in yrs
28.article_body: For the first time in a decade, Australia has raised the number of permanent migrants that it will accept this financial year to 1,95,000. "We want people...to have a mortgage, to raise a family, to join the Australian family," said Australian PM Anthony Albanese. Australia's unemployment rate is at a 50-year low but there are around 4,80,000 job vacancies there.

29.title: Woman arrested for killing 3 daughters in Bihar's Buxar district
29.article_body: A woman was arrested on Friday in Bihar's Buxar district for allegedly murdering her three daughters by strangulation, a police official said. According to police, the accused has admitted that she strangled her daughters, aged between four and eight years, to death on Thursday night. However, she did not specify the motive behind her action, police added.

30.title: At 36, I'll be happy to end the season in top 5: World no. 3 Nadal
30.article_body: After Rafael Nadal became the first player to qualify for the season-ending ATP Finals in Turin, the world number three said, "One more year at the age of 36- finish the year probably, if nothing goes wrong, in the top five." Nadal qualified after winning the second round at US Open 2022. Nadal has never won the season-ending ATP tournament.

31.title: Look out circular issued against social media influencer Bobby Kataria
31.article_body: Delhi Police has issued a look out circular against social media influencer Balvinder alias Bobby Kataria over a video where he was seen smoking a cigarette on board a SpiceJet flight in January. "Our teams had recently raided one of his locations, but he was not found there. Now look out circular has been issued against him," police said.

32.title: 20 more Jammu Congress leaders quit party in support of Azad: Report
32.article_body: As many as 20 leaders of District Congress Committee-Jammu North quit Congress on Friday in support of former party veteran Ghulam Nabi Azad, ANI reported. This comes after 36 Congress leaders resigned on Thursday. Before that, another 64 Congress leaders had resigned from the party, days after Azad left Congress. Azad is reportedly planning to launch a new national party.

33.title: 2 Maoists killed in encounter with security forces in Jharkhand
33.article_body: Two Maoists were killed in an encounter with security forces in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharsawan district on Friday, a senior police official said. The joint operation was carried out by CRPF's CoBRA, Jharkhand Jaguar, and the state police, he added. An SLR, over 100 live cartridges, magazines, detonators and wireless sets were reportedly recovered from the slain Maoists' possession, he informed.

34.title: Truck carrying 46 dead cattle found in Gujarat; driver escapes
34.article_body: Police in Gujarat's Valsad stopped a container truck carrying 46 dead cattle inside. "The container [truck's] driver and owner had not made water, food or air ventilation available in the container, which led to the death of the cattle," Valsad SP said. The driver of the truck escaped when police stopped the vehicle on the Sutharpada-Nashik road for checking.

35.title: Teacher burns 3-year-old boy's private parts for urinating in underpants in Karnataka
35.article_body: A teacher in an Anganwadi daycare centre in Karnataka's Tumkur district burned the genitals of a 3-year-old boy. The teacher, along with her assistant, burned the child's genitals with matchstick for urinating in his underpants. She earlier tried to issue an apology and resolve the matter to avoid legal action. Police officials informed that the crime took place on Monday.

36.title: Internal Congress election rolls must be made public: Tharoor
36.article_body: Senior Congress leaders Shashi Tharoor and Pradyut Bordoloi have written to the party's Central Election Authority, demanding electoral rolls to elect the party's next president be made public. Bordoloi demanded the state-wise electoral rolls be uploaded on the Congress website. Earlier, party leaders Manish Tewari, Karti Chidambaram and Anand Sharma said the move would ensure transparency.

37.title: Disappointing to miss out CWG due to COVID: Midfielder Navjot Kaur
37.article_body: Indian women's hockey team midfielder Navjot Kaur, who has more than 200 international caps, said missing a major tournament like Commonwealth Games was "hard to accept" as she could not compete in Birmingham Games after contracting COVID-19. The 27-year-old tested positive for COVID-19 when she was in Nottingham for a training camp. "I had no major symptoms," she added.

38.title: Bail plea of Tyagi, arrested for abusing Noida woman, rejected
38.article_body: A Noida court rejected the bail application filed by politician Shrikant Tyagi, who was arrested for assaulting and abusing a woman in his residential society on August 5. The 34-year-old was arrested on August 9 from Meerut by the Noida Police. While Tyagi had claimed to be a BJP functionary, the party had denied any links with him.

39.title: Uttarakhand Police ranks first in recovering stolen goods: NCRB
39.article_body: Uttarakhand Police have topped the list in effectiveness of state police forces in recovering stolen goods, the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) said. In 2021, Uttarakhand recorded 68.7% in the rate of recovery of stolen property and goods, which was double the national average of 30.2%. Uttarakhand Police also cracked the most number of theft cases, DGP Ashok Kumar said.

40.title: What is the significance of Chhatrapati Shivaji's seal used in the new Navy ensign?
40.article_body: Indian Navy's new ensign bears the seal of the Maratha emperor Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, who is known to have laid the foundation for the modern Navy in India. The blue octagon encasing the National Emblem represents the eight directions, symbolising the Navy's "multidirectional reach and operational capability". The anchor depicted below the Emblem represents steadfastness, the Navy said.

41.title: Allegations against Murugha Mutt seer 'serious': Cong's Siddaramaiah
41.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah said the allegations against the chief pontiff of Sri Murugha Mutt were "serious" in nature. "Police should carry out [an] impartial investigation based on the complaint filed by the girls and reveal the truth," Siddaramaiah tweeted. His comment comes days after the chief pontiff of the mutt in Karnataka's Chitradurga was accused of sexually abusing minor girls.

42.title: Won't tolerate corruption: Bihar CM after RJD leader's resignation
42.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said corrupt people are not being sheltered by his government nor would any act of corruption be tolerated under his regime. Kumar was reacting to RJD MLC Kartik Kumar's resignation as state minister after facing allegations in connection with a 2014 kidnapping case. A district court had ruled that Kartik cannot be arrested until September 1.

43.title: Club owner, 2 others sent to 7-day judicial custody in Sonali's murder case
43.article_body: The special Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) court sent Edwin Nunes, owner of Goa's Curlies beach shack, and two other alleged drug peddlers to seven-day judicial custody in connection with the murder of BJP leader Sonali Phogat. The trio has applied for bail, which will be heard on September 6.

44.title: Kashmir Files was made by an unknown director, yet it collected ₹250 cr: RGV
44.article_body: Ram Gopal Varma, talking about Vivek Agnihotri's directorial 'The Kashmir Files', said, "It's made by an unknown director whom Bollywood never took seriously...Yet, it ended up making ₹250 crores domestically." He added that it's "the slowest film ever made". "It goes against whatever we, as filmmakers, learnt what not to be made...There's no screenplay...no interval, no climax," said Varma.

45.title: 32-yr-old BSF constable found dead in Tripura's Khowai district
45.article_body: A 32-year-old Border Security Force (BSF) constable, Balu Ram Kuri, posted in Tripura's Khowai district was found dead at the sector headquarters at Khasiamangal in Teliamura area. Kuri was reportedly on sentry duty at the battalion headquarters. "His body was found lying in a pool of blood. Our officials...sent the body for postmortem," Teliamura sub-divisional police officer said.

46.title: Rohit has taken on that role of playing with an aggressive mindset: Saba
46.article_body: Commenting on Rohit Sharma's recent string of low scores, Saba Karim said the India captain is a big player and he'll certainly know what needs to be done to score big. "But...he has taken on that role of playing with an aggressive mindset, which is important for at least one of the top three to have," he added.

47.title: PM Modi's Mangaluru tour will see development or disaster?: Siddaramaiah
47.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi visited Karnataka's Mangaluru to inaugurate various projects on Friday, Congress leader Siddaramaiah commented on the former's trip to the coastal city. "Welcome PM Modi...Is this visit of yours a tour to see the development? Or to see the disaster?...You completely erased the names of the 3 banks. Is this development? Or [a] disaster?" Siddaramaiah said.

48.title: Will fight local polls in alliance with Shinde group: Maha BJP Prez
48.article_body: Maharashtra BJP President Chandrashekhar Bawankule on Friday said his party will contest the local elections in alliance with the Shiv Sena faction led by CM Eknath Shinde. As part of the BJP's Mission 2024, in which Central ministers will go to Lok Sabha constituencies to check welfare projects, Chandrapur will be visited by Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri, Bawankule added.

49.title: BJP leaders roam around with bags full of money to poach MLAs: Baghel
49.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Friday criticised BJP and said the party cannot tolerate opposition, so they roam around with bags full of money and poach MLAs of opposition parties. Speaking in Raipur, Baghel said, "They also try to scare leaders in the name of ED and IT departments." Baghel further alleged that BJP doesn't work for the people's interest.

50.title: BCCI bought Neeraj Chopra's javelin for ₹1.5 crore during auction of PM's gifts: Report
50.article_body: The winning bid of ₹1.5 crore for Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra's javelin, when PM Narendra Modi's collection of mementos was e-auctioned last year, was made by BCCI, an official told PTI. "As an organisation we're proud that we have a sporting good of one of India's greatest athletes," the official was quoted as saying by PTI.

51.title: Warner trolled for 'Lucky man mate' comment on Anushka's photo shared by Kohli, responds
51.article_body: Australia opener David Warner was trolled after he commented "Lucky man mate" on Anushka Sharma's photo shared by Virat Kohli on Instagram, with a user writing, "Are you jealous?" Warner responded, writing, "It's a saying...in Australia...like I'd say I'm lucky to have Candice so when we say to others we say 'you're lucky mate'...Interpretation is always going to be different."

52.title: Woman pushed off train for resisting rape dies in Haryana, son found alone in coach
52.article_body: A 30-year-old woman died after she was thrown out of a running train by a man who attempted to molest her in Haryana's Fatehabad, police said. The woman's 9-year-old son, who was travelling with his mother, was found crying alone in the train coach by his father at Tohana station. The accused, who jumped out of the train, was arrested.

53.title: Switzerland's 2nd largest bank Credit Suisse looking at laying off 5,000 people: Reports
53.article_body: Switzerland's second-largest bank Credit Suisse is considering cutting around 5,000 jobs, about one position in ten, as part of a cost reduction drive, reports said. Credit Suisse has already said it will cut costs below 15.5 billion Swiss francs ($15.8 billion) in the medium term, versus an annualised 16.8 billion francs this year.

54.title: Congress reduced to bhai-behan party: JP Nadda in Haryana
54.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Friday criticised Congress and said it had been reduced to a bhai-behan (brother-sister) party. Addressing a rally in Haryana's Kaithal, Nadda said, "The BJP is the only democratic party of the country that cares about every section of society." He further said the Congress divided people on the basis of caste, religion and region.

55.title: Facebook shutting down Neighbourhoods following tests in US and Canada
55.article_body: Facebook's parent company Meta confirmed that it's shutting down Neighbourhoods, its Nextdoor clone that was being tested since last year in US and Canada to standardise the way neighbours connect and share local information on Facebook. The company said it realised the best way to move forward in this area was to allow people to continue to use Facebook Groups.

56.title: Sanjay Kapoor cheated on me during our marriage, says Maheep Kapoor
56.article_body: Maheep Kapoor revealed on 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' season 2 that her husband, actor Sanjay Kapoor, cheated on her in the early days of their marriage. She further revealed that she had "walked out" with their daughter Shanaya. Speaking about revealing this, Maheep told India Today, "I am hoping that women will understand that everything is not hunky dory."

57.title: Haridwar hate speech accused Jitendra Tyagi surrenders before court
57.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh Shia Central Waqf Board chairperson Jitendra Narayan Tyagi, who is an accused in the Haridwar hate speech case, on Friday surrendered before a court in Haridwar. This comes after the Supreme Court turned down his application for the extension of his bail on Monday. "I've full faith in the judiciary and law of the country," Tyagi said.

58.title: Hrithik rejects 'Brahmastra 2' due to 'Krrish 4' & 'Ramayana': Report
58.article_body: Hrithik Roshan has reportedly rejected the offer to star in 'Brahmastra 2'. The actor was reportedly offered the lead role named Dev in the film. "Hrithik is...doing two high-on visual effects films, Krrish 4 and Ramayana. He felt...doing Brahmastra 2 would mean too much of...time investment on another VFX-heavy film...He wants to do more films," a source told Bollywood Hungama.

59.title: Bihar locals carry patient to hospital on makeshift boat amid floods
59.article_body: A video has emerged showing two men pushing a makeshift boat through knee-deep water to get a patient to hospital in a flood-hit village of Bihar's Bhagalpur. Another man held a saline bottle while sitting beside the patient on the boat, which was apparently made of water barrels and bamboo sticks. "Ganga Mandal was severely ill," the village head said.

60.title: I've been offered films by 2 very big B'wood producers: Karthikeya 2's Nikhil
60.article_body: Actor Nikhil Siddhartha, who was recently seen in 'Karthikeya 2', said in an interview that two "very big" production houses of Bollywood have approached him for their upcoming films. He added that many people from Bollywood called him and "showered their love" on his film. Nikhil further said he doesn't differentiate between Bollywood and Tollywood, adding, "It's all Indian cinema."

61.title: Difficult to find momentum with not much gametime: Rajkumar on KL Rahul
61.article_body: Former India skipper Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said that it is "difficult" for batter KL Rahul to find "momentum with not much gametime". "Rahul is coming back after a long injury lay-off...He has given some big performances for India and having been appointed vice-captain shows how much the team management has faith in him," Sharma said.

62.title: Telangana Martyrs' Memorial in Hyd set to be inaugurated by yr-end: KTR
62.article_body: Telangana Martyrs' Memorial in Hyderabad is getting ready to be inaugurated by the end of 2022, minister KT Rama Rao (KTR) announced on Friday. The 50-metre-tall structure is designed in the form of 'diya' in honour of those who sacrificed their lives for the separate state of Telangana. It is being built at an estimated cost of ₹80 crore.

63.title: Gallantry award winners exhibit opens at Rajouri Garden metro station
63.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation has inaugurated a permanent exhibition on gallantry award recipients of the armed forces at Rajouri Garden metro station. Named 'Veerta aur Vikas', the exhibition is spread across over 100 feet, with 13 panels dedicated to the efforts of the gallantry awardees. The exhibition also has a section on major events in India since 1947.

64.title: K'taka's Murugha Mutt seer sent to 4-day police custody for raping 2 minor girls
64.article_body: A district court in Karnataka's Chitradurga on Friday sent Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, the chief pontiff of Sri Murugha Mutt, to four-day police custody for allegedly raping two minor girls. The police had, however, sought his custody for five days. The seer was arrested on Thursday night.

65.title: Half-naked Odisha woman found dead in Gurugram, police suspect rape
65.article_body: A half-naked woman was found dead at a plot in Gurugram's DLF Phase 3 on Thursday, police said. The deceased, who was 50 years old, is suspected to have been raped, they said. The woman hailed from Odisha and her body was kept in the mortuary for post-mortem. Initial findings indicate the woman was strangled.

66.title: Germany to pay 28 mn euros to families of Olympics attack victims
66.article_body: Germany and the families of the Israeli athletes killed in the 1972 Munich Olympics terrorist attack have agreed on a compensation amount of 28 million euros, Berlin said on Friday. Last month, the families of the victims had said that they were unhappy with the German compensation offer. The 1972 attack was carried out by Palestinian terror group Black September.

67.title: SL mock B'desh over 'no world class bowler' remark after knocking them out of Asia Cup
67.article_body: Sri Lanka mocked Bangladesh over their Team Director Khaled Mahmud's remark that Sri Lanka don't have any world class bowlers in their side. After knocking Bangladesh out of the Asia Cup 2022, Sri Lanka commented on a Facebook post showing the match scorecard, writing, "Bangladesh, who without world class bowlers, lost the game, is it?"

68.title: Don't agree that KL Rahul needs to be given time: Reetinder Sodhi
68.article_body: Former India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi said that batter KL Rahul doesn't need to be "given time". "I don't agree that Rahul needs to be given time because where do you have time left?...His strike rate against Hong Kong is very worrying," Sodhi said. "He has great numbers, but you just can't rely on them all the time," he added.

69.title: I've been her fan since I was a kid: Ajla on facing Serena at US Open 2022
69.article_body: Ahead of US Open 2022 third round match against 23-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams, who is expected to retire after the tournament, Australia's Ajla Tomljanovic said, "It's going to be a huge moment no matter the outcome." She added, "I've been a Serena fan since I was a kid. On Friday night I'll just be a competitor."

70.title: No such proposal before govt: Fadnavis on reports of 2 civic bodies in Pune
70.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis opened up about reports stating that the state government was planning to bifurcate Pune Municipal Corporation and said, "There is no such proposal before the state government." "I'm not going to be guardian minister of Pune. Also, I am not going to contest Lok Sabha elections from Pune," he added.

71.title: FIR against 7 minors for violence at Yerwada observation home
71.article_body: Seven minors were booked after violence was reported from the government-run observation home in Yerwada. On August 25, juveniles were playing football when a brawl and stone-pelting started after some minors were hit by a ball, police said. The minors were booked under sections 143, 144, 147, 149, 323, 504 and 336 of the Indian Penal Code.

72.title: Woman dies after treatment at IVF centre run by fake doctor in Gr Noida
72.article_body: A woman reportedly died of 'gross negligence' during treatment at an In-Vitro Fertilisation (IVF) centre run by a fake doctor in Greater Noida. The woman was taking IVF treatment from Priyaranjan Thakur for the past two months. She fell ill during treatment on August 19 and slipped into a coma. She was admitted to another hospital where she died.

73.title: No reservation in Delhi colleges for students passing from NCR schools: HC
73.article_body: A student from Delhi who passed his class 12 examination from an NCR school cannot avail reservation benefits available to "Delhi candidates" for admission to colleges in Delhi, the Delhi HC has held. The order was passed on a petition by a student who passed class 12 from a Gurugram school and sought reservation benefits for college admission in Delhi.

74.title: 6 booked for defrauding Pune investors of ₹1.68 crore
74.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Police have booked six people, including the Director of JBC Capital Private Limited, for allegedly defrauding investors of ₹1.68 crore, said officials. The accused were identified as Rahul Gulabsingh Jakhad, Director of JBC Capital Private Limited, Ramhari Munde, among others. Jakhad would allegedly approach investors, promising them a 10% return every month.

75.title: Samajwadi Party delegation meets Shrikant Tyagi's family in Noida
75.article_body: A delegation of Samajwadi Party leaders met politician Shrikant Tyagi's family members on Friday in Noida. The party had earlier announced that its members would meet Tyagi's family to inquire about the harassment faced by him in police custody. Tyagi is in jail for allegedly assaulting a woman. "We're here to meet both the parties," SP leader Sunil Choudhary said.

76.title: Anti-Muslim tweets 'liked' by Chaayos' Twitter handle, Founder says it was hacked
76.article_body: Cafe chain Chaayos is facing criticism online for 'liking' anti-Muslim tweets. After many Twitter users shared screenshots of the 'likes section' of Chaayos' official account, it said, "There was an offensive tweet that was inadvertently liked from our account. Chaayos detests and denies any view mentioned in the said tweet." Chaayos Founder Nitin Saluja later said the account was hacked.

77.title: 4 persons, including 2 women, held in Ambala; 1 kg heroin seized
77.article_body: Four persons, including two women, were arrested and one kilogram of heroin was recovered from their vehicle during checking near cantonment area in Ambala on Friday, police said. Based on a tip-off, police set up a checkpoint on Ambala-Delhi Highway, Superintendent of Police said. Police intercepted the vehicle and found narcotics hidden inside the handbags of the women, SP added.

78.title: Playing doubles is good money, makes my girlfriend happy: Kyrgios
78.article_body: Eighth seeds Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis entered the men's doubles second round at US Open 2022 after defeating unseeded Hugo Gaston and Lorenzo Musetti on Thursday. Following the win, Kyrgios said, "Honestly, I'd rather play doubles than practice. It's good money too and makes my girlfriend happy." Kyrgios and Kokkinakis won Australian Open 2022 men's doubles title in January.

79.title: Motorcyclists to be penalised for taking shelter below flyovers in Bengaluru
79.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police has decided to impose a fine on motorcyclists for taking shelter at underpasses and below flyovers during rainfall. "When vehicles are parked on roads below underpasses and flyovers in the rainy season it causes accidents," an official said. A fine of ₹500 has been proposed for the first-time offenders and case against repeat offenders, police said.

80.title: Ben Kingsley to reprise his role from Iron Man 3 in Wonder Man: Reports
80.article_body: Actor Ben Kingsley is all set to reprise the role of Trevor Slattery in the upcoming 'Wonder Man' series from Marvel Studios, as per reports. Ben's Slattery appeared in 'Iron Man 3' and 'Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings'. Destin Daniel Cretton, who directed 'Shang-Chi', will reportedly serve as an executive producer and co-creator of the series.

81.title: Pawan has a larger-than-life personality, is a gun freak: Director Saagar
81.article_body: Director Saagar K Chandra, who worked with Pawan Kalyan in film 'Bheemla Nayak', said in an interview that the actor has a larger-than-life personality. "He adds certain nuances to...character which is all Pawan Kalyan. When you see a scene, that 20-30 per cent extra layering is his art and knowledge," he added. Saagar further said Pawan is a "gun freak".

82.title: Delhi LG 'illegally awarded' interior designing contract to daughter: AAP
82.article_body: AAP MP Sanjay Singh has accused Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena of illegally awarding his daughter an interior designing contract. "Saxena, during his term as KVIC chairman, misused his position and awarded a contract for interior designing of a Khadi lounge in Mumbai to...daughter," he alleged. "He violated..the KVIC Act 1961," Singh said, adding PM Modi should immediately sack him.

83.title: Tourism body seizes Hyd amusement park over ₹16.70 cr unpaid fees
83.article_body: Telangana State Tourism Development Corporation on Thursday confiscated an amusement park named Snow World in Hyderabad after it failed to pay the lease rent and other fees totalling ₹16.70 crore. Officials from the tourism body closed the park's entrance. The park will not be opened to the public until the administration has paid all outstanding debts, an official said.

84.title: Ravindra Jadeja ruled out of Asia Cup 2022, replaced by Axar Patel
84.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has been ruled out of Asia Cup 2022 after sustaining a right knee injury. He is currently under the supervision of the BCCI medical team, the BCCI stated.  He has been replaced by Axar Patel for remainder of the tournament. Axar was earlier named as one of the standbys in the squad.

85.title: SC grants interim bail to activist Teesta in case related to Gujarat riots
85.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday granted interim bail to activist Teesta Setalvad in a case related to the 2002 Gujarat riots. Setalvad was asked to afford complete cooperation in the probe of the alleged conspiracy and surrender her passport. She was arrested on June 25 for allegedly falsifying evidence to 'frame' innocent people in the riot cases.

86.title: We won't sell oil to countries that set price caps: Russia
86.article_body: Russia will stop selling oil to countries that impose price caps on Russia's energy resources, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. "We simply will not cooperate with them on non-market principles," Peskov added, saying the caps will lead to significant destabilisation of the global oil market. Earlier, the European Union imposed a partial ban on Russian oil purchases over Ukraine war.

87.title: Meta, Qualcomm sign deal to produce custom virtual reality chips
87.article_body: Meta Platforms entered into an agreement with chip-maker Qualcomm to produce custom chipsets for its Quest virtual reality devices. The engineering and product teams of the companies will work together to produce the chips, which will be powered by Qualcomm's Snapdragon platforms, both the firms said in a statement at a consumer electronics conference in Berlin on Friday.

88.title: Bridgerton's Charithra Chandran wears Manish Malhotra for magazine shoot
88.article_body: Actress Charithra Chandran, known for portraying Edwina Sharma in television series 'Bridgerton', wore designer Manish Malhotra's collection to feature on the cover of Conde Nast Traveller's Indian edition. The outfits she wore are from Malhotra's Khaab Mijwan 2022 collection. The Indian-origin actress shared pictures on social media, writing, "I'll never say no to dressing up as an Indian Bride."

89.title: Difficult for IAEA to impartially assess Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant: Ukraine
89.article_body: Ukraine's state nuclear company, Energoatom, said it'll be "difficult" for the UN nuclear watchdog, IAEA, to make an impartial assessment of the situation at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant due to Russian interference. The IAEA team, which arrived at the Russian-occupied power station on Thursday, wasn't allowed to enter the plant's crisis centre, where Russia has stationed troops, it added.

90.title: INS Vikrant is a significant step for India's maritime security: Rahul
90.article_body: After India's first indigenously-built aircraft carrier, Vikrant, was commissioned in a ceremony on Friday, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that the 860ft long and 197ft tall vessel is "a significant step for India's maritime security". "Many congratulations to the Indian Navy, the Naval Design Bureau and Cochin Shipyard for the many years of hard work," Rahul tweeted.

91.title: Earthquake of 4.9 magnitude hits Andaman and Nicobar Islands
91.article_body: An earthquake of 4.9 magnitude on the Richter scale shook Andaman and Nicobar Islands this afternoon. According to reports, the epicentre of the earthquake was 108 kilometre North-Northeast of Diglipur. The epicentre was estimated to be at a depth of 10 kilometre. No casualties or damages have been reported by authorities so far.

92.title: Piyush Goyal to meet American counterparts on US visit next week
92.article_body: Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal will embark on a six-day US visit starting September 5. He will hold bilateral meetings with his American counterparts to discuss ways to boost trade and investment ties. Goyal will also participate in the two-day ministerial meeting of Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity on September 8 and 9 in Los Angeles.

93.title: 'Brahmāstra' made at a cost of ₹410 crore, most expensive Hindi film ever: Report
93.article_body: Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmāstra' has been made on a budget of ₹410 crore, as per reports. This would make it the costliest Hindi film of all time. The budget reportedly excludes publicity expenses and the high budget is largely due to the extensive VFX work that has been done on the film, reports added.

94.title: He was my guru: Ankita Lokhande on Sushant Singh Rajput
94.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande recently appeared as a guest on 'DID Super Moms' and broke down after watching a performance dedicated to late actor Sushant Singh Rajput. She said, "It would not have been possible for me to be what I am today without Sushant, he was my guru." Ankita and Sushant were in a relationship from 2010 until 2016.

95.title: INS Vikrant is a collective effort of all governments since 1999: Congress
95.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi commissioned country's first indigenous aircraft carrier INS Vikrant, Congress criticised the PM and asked whether he would acknowledge collective effort of all the governments since 1999. "INS Vikrant is a huge achievement but it was started 22 years ago. First Vajpayee govt, then Manmohan govt and then Modi govt, there is continuity," said Congress' Jairam Ramesh.

96.title: Around 50% rape charges in Rajasthan false: CM Ashok Gehlot
96.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that around 50% of the rape charges in the state are false. The high numbers are due to compulsory registration of FIRs in every case, he added. "The crime in Rajasthan is very less compared to other states...we have corrected that environment," he further said. "Most of the time perpetrators are girl's relatives...family," Gehlot stated.

97.title: Several birds die due to tree felling in Kerala; video surfaces
97.article_body: The Kerala Forests Department has taken legal action against a contractor after the alleged felling of a tree to widen the National Highway in Malappuram caused the deaths of several newly-hatched birds and damaged multiple eggs. A video of the incident has surfaced online, which purportedly shows the tree being felled and the birds lying dead on road.

98.title: Delhi saw a jump in hit-and-run cases in 2021: Report
98.article_body: Delhi witnessed a rise in hit-and-run cases in 2021, a transport department report said. According to the report, hit-and-run cases accounted for 59% of the total fatal road accidents in the national capital in 2021, as compared to 51% in 2020. Out of the total victims of hit-and-run crashes in 2021, the majority belonged to the 25-29 age group (95).

99.title: Pan-India films is useless debate, we just want to tell stories: Huma
99.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi stated that the debate about pan-India films is useless, adding that artists just want to be a part of films and tell entertaining stories. Huma further said she doesn't believe in the debate. "It's a great time to be an actor, you can explore so much and not just for OTT...The world is your oyster," she added.

100.title: GHMC provides mobile pond service for immersion of Ganesh idols
100.article_body: As a part of Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) along with the Freedom Group is providing mobile pond service for immersion of Ganesh idols. The mobile immersion vehicles were inaugurated by Telangana Minister Talasani Srinivas Yadav on Friday. On Thursday, as many as 74 immersion sites were prepared by GHMC for immersion of Ganesh idols.

101.title: Tamil actress Mahalakshmi marries filmmaker Ravindar Chandrasekaran
101.article_body: Tamil actress Mahalakshmi got married to Tamil filmmaker-actor Ravindar Chandrasekaran on Thursday in a traditional ceremony attended by their family and close friends. The ceremony was held at Tirumala Tirupati in Andhra Pradesh. The couple shared pictures from the ceremony on their respective social media accounts. Ravindar also shared a short video of their wedding ceremony from his account.

102.title: Top seed Swiatek beats 2017 champion Stephens to enter US Open 3rd round
102.article_body: Top seed Iga Swiatek defeated 2017 champion Sloane Stephens 6-3, 6-2 in the second round at US Open 2022 on Thursday. The world number one beat the American for the second time in three weeks to reach the third round. Swiatek has reached the round of 32 for a third consecutive year. She won the match in 74 minutes.

103.title: BMC makes 162 artificial ponds for immersion of Ganesh idols in Mumbai
103.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said it has made 162 artificial ponds for immersion of Ganesh idols in Mumbai, adding 73 natural immersion sites are available. This comes after the civic body asked devotees to immerse idols made of Plaster of Paris (PoP) in artificial lakes to reduce pollution. According to BMC, 22,687 idols were immersed in Mumbai on Thursday.

104.title: FIRs to be filed against Ganesh mandals using illegal electricity
104.article_body: The state government has decided to file FIRs against Ganesh mandals who are using illegal electricity connections for their pandals,  MSEDCL officials have warned. According to reports, only 30 mandals have requested a connection in Pimpri Chinchwad, and most of others are using unauthorised electricity sources. Authorities had requested the mandals to obtain temporary connections earlier.

105.title: Centre spent ₹5 lakh crore on MGNREGA scheme in 8 yrs: Sitharaman
105.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government spent ₹5 lakh crore on MGNREGA scheme in the past eight years, of which 20% was spent during the COVID-19 pandemic. The government had said in the Budget announcement in February that it was targeting lower-than-expected outgo for subsidy, MGNREGA and Finance Commission transfers to states, through which ₹1.88 lakh crore was saved.

106.title: I've made a living selling guilty pleasures: Karan Johar on 'Fabulous Lives...'
106.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, who produces the reality show 'The Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives', has called it a guilty pleasure. He further said, "I have made a living selling guilty pleasures." The first season of the series released in 2020 and features the professional and personal lives of star wives Neelam Kothari, Bhavana Pandey, Seema Kiran Sajdeh and Maheep Kapoor.

107.title: Will force Aamir, Big B to watch The Rings of Power: 'Thugs...' co-star Lloyd
107.article_body: Lloyd Owen, when asked if he's planning to show 'The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power' to his 'Thugs of Hindostan' co-stars Aamir Khan and Amitabh Bachchan, said, "I'll force everyone in the team to watch it." The British actor played the role of John Clive in the 2018 film, which was directed by Vijay Krishna Acharya.

108.title: Getting asset management company licence in India is hard: Zerodha CEO
108.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath told Moneycontrol that "getting an asset management company (AMC) licence in this country is quite hard". Zerodha is awaiting final approval from market regulator SEBI to set up its AMC business. While he refused to predict the market in the near or the long term, Kamath said India will continue to outperform other markets.

109.title: Gujarat woman throws her 3 kids in canal, then jumps in it with lover
109.article_body: A woman threw her three children into a canal in Gujarat and is believed to have jumped in the same canal with her lover, reports said. Chandhar village's former Sarpanch said that villagers saw bodies of two children floating in the canal. Meanwhile, cell phones were also found. The bodies of all three children have been recovered, he added.

110.title: Mumbai mobile shop owner held for dealing in stolen phones, 27 phones seized
110.article_body: A 22-year-old mobile shop owner, Zameer Hasan Sameer Sayyed, was arrested in Mumbai for allegedly dealing in stolen mobile phones. Sayyed was arrested from his house in Govandi and 27 mobile phones worth ₹4.82 lakh were seized from his shop, police said. Sayyed's role was identified while investigating a mobile snatching case that took place on August 25, police added.

111.title: Buy £20 kettle to save £10 in electricity bills a year: UK PM to citizens
111.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson has been criticised on social media for suggesting citizens to buy a £20 (₹1,846) kettle to save £10 (₹923) in electricity bills over the next 12 months. "This is the best the PM of this country can come up with?" a user said. The UK is currently experiencing a cost-of-living crisis, which is likely to worsen.

112.title: 2 arrested for blackmailing girl using obscene video in Srinagar
112.article_body: Two boys have been arrested in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar for allegedly blackmailing a girl using an obscene video of her. According to police, the two extorted money from the girl from time to time by threatening to circulate the video through WhatsApp. Subsequently, they shared the video with some Shunglipora residents, added police.

113.title: Hyderabad man sentenced to 2 years in jail for abducting minor
113.article_body: A local court in Hyderabad on Thursday reportedly sentenced a man, Namala Babu, to two years in jail for abducting a 17-year-old girl in December 2020. The minor girl went missing while returning from the shop where she was employed. The police traced the victim and based on her statement, sections under POCSO Act and Juvenile Justice Act were added.

114.title: Ex-Sri Lanka Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa allowed to travel abroad
114.article_body: Sri Lanka's highest court has temporarily lifted the overseas travel ban imposed on former Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa, the country's anti-corruption body said. He has been ordered to return by January 15, 2023. Basil's brother ex-Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa had fled the country in July amid mass protests. The Rajapaksa family is blamed for Sri Lanka's economic crisis.

115.title: Sidharth's family holds prayer meet for actor ahead of his death anniversary
115.article_body: Late actor Sidharth Shukla's family held a prayer meet with the Brahma Kumaris on the eve of his first death anniversary. The actor died of a reported heart attack aged 40 last year. In a picture that has surfaced online, his family can be seen posing with the Brahma Kumaris. Another photo showed prasad being distributed among people.

116.title: 5-yr-old dies at MP govt hospital, family alleges no treatment was offered
116.article_body: The family of a five-year-old boy who died at a Primary Health Centre in Madhya Pradesh alleged that lack of treatment was the cause of his death. Reports said that a senior government official, however, claimed the child had been brought dead to the PHC. Video of a woman sitting on ground with the boy in lap had gone viral.

117.title: Markets end flat with Sensex over 58,800 points, Nifty at 17,539
117.article_body: Benchmark indices ended on a flat note on Friday. Sensex closed 36.74 points higher at 58,803.33, while Nifty lost 3.30 points to 17,539.50. BPCL, Shree Cements, Hero MotoCorp, Hindalco Industries and ONGC were among the major Nifty losers, while stocks of HDFC, ITC, Adani Ports, Larsen and Toubro and HDFC Bank gained. The capital goods index rose by 1%.

118.title: Amber seemed to f*ck with Johnny's head again after his mom's death: Doug
118.article_body: Johnny Depp's friend Doug Stanhope has called the former's ex-wife Amber Heard a "relentlessly scheming and insulting opportunist" in his book 'No Encore for the Donkey'. He further wrote that after Johnny's mother passed away in 2016, Amber "seemed to be f*cking with his head again...using this opportunity of his weakness to manipulate him even more and harder".

119.title: India's campaign ends at Japan Open 2022 with Prannoy's loss in quarters
119.article_body: Indian shuttler HS Prannoy lost in the men's singles quarter-final against Chou Tien Chen of Chinese Taipei at Japan Open on Friday. The World Championships 2022 bronze medallist beat Prannoy 21-17, 15-21, 22-20 in one hour and 21 minutes. With this, India's campaign has ended at the tournament. Earlier, India's Kidambi Srikanth lost in the pre-quarterfinal.

120.title: 12 people booked for car fraud worth ₹86.8 lakh in Navi Mumbai
120.article_body: Navi Mumbai's Kharghar Police have booked 12 people, including the General Manager of a car showroom, for fraud worth ₹86.8 lakh. The accused GM allegedly never delivered the booked expensive cars to the customers, police said. Later, he would allegedly make a booking in another customer's name for a vehicle of less value and pocket the difference, police added.

121.title: Man pours hand sanitiser on wife, sets her on fire in Odisha
121.article_body: A 25-year-old woman is battling for life after her husband allegedly poured hand sanitiser on her and set her on fire in Odisha's Ganjam on Thursday. The man had apparently done so after failing to push his wife off of their house's terrace. Reportedly, the woman's family had given ₹1.7 lakh as dowry but her in-laws were demanding more money.

122.title: UP man elopes with girlfriend, stabs her; flees with cash, jewellery
122.article_body: A man, who eloped with his 22-year-old girlfriend, stabbed her and fled along with her cash and jewellery in Uttar Pradesh's Kaushambi, police said. The victim was critically injured and has been admitted to a hospital. The victim claimed that she had been in a relationship with the accused and he had promised to marry her, police stated.

123.title: 6-year-old girl mauled by pitbull in Ghaziabad
123.article_body: A six-year-old girl was reportedly mauled by a pitbull in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. The girl was playing in a local park on August 15 when the incident happened. Her father said she sustained severe injuries in one of her ears that will require treatment for over two years. He has also filed a complaint against the dog owner.

124.title: Twitter banned over 45,000 accounts in India in July for violating guidelines
124.article_body: In its monthly compliance report released on Friday, Twitter said it banned 45,191 Indian users' accounts in July for violating its guidelines. Of these, 42,825 accounts were blocked for promoting child sexual exploitation and non-consensual nudity, while another 2,366 accounts were blocked for promoting terrorism. In June, Twitter banned over 43,000 Indian accounts.

125.title: Traffic police staff clears choked drain with bare hands in B'luru
125.article_body: A traffic police staff recently cleared a choked drain on a waterlogged road near Bengaluru's Echo World area with his bare hands. Sharing the video of the incident, HAL Airport Traffic Police Station tweeted, "Our officer Ms Nagamani and staff Mr Bheemashi clearing the waterlogging." A Twitter user commented, "That's not his job...He can't clear gutter with his bare hands!"

126.title: Work is something we do, not who we are: Tata's manager on 18-hr workday debate
126.article_body: Ratan Tata's General Manager Shantanu Naidu commented on the 18-hour workday debate, after Bombay Shaving Company's CEO Shantanu Deshpande advised freshers to work for 18 hours a day. "'Work is something we do, not who we are' is something I heard...I really believe in that," said Naidu. "In the end, it's more...[about]...what we leave behind for other people," he added.

127.title: K'taka seer complains of uneasiness day after arrest in sexual abuse case
127.article_body: Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, the head seer of Murugha Mutt in Karnataka's Chitradurga district who was arrested on Thursday for allegedly sexually abusing high school girls, complained of uneasiness on Friday, after he was sent to jail in the case. Reports said that he was taken to a hospital. Police said that the accused was questioned in the case.

128.title: So happy for 3 of you: Sushmita on brother Rajeev, Charu calling off divorce
128.article_body: After Rajeev Sen and Charu Asopa announced their decision to call off their divorce on social media, the former's sister actress Sushmita Sen took to the comment section to react. She wrote, "I am soooooo happy for all 3 of you!!! Dugga Dugga Shona." Charu had earlier said that her sister-in-law Sushmita has been a "huge emotional support".

129.title: PM inaugurates mechanisation, industrialisation projects worth ₹3800 cr in Mangaluru
129.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated and laid the foundation stone of mechanisation and industrialisation projects worth ₹3800 crore in Mangaluru. "New India is the land of new opportunities...These projects will help in strengthening trade and commerce with an increase in ease of doing business," he said. He also spoke about India's vision of "Green Growth".

130.title: Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma spending ₹19 crore for farmhouse in Alibaug: Reports
130.article_body: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma are spending ₹19.24 crore for a farmhouse that will be set up on 8 acres of land in Alibaug, according to reports. A deposit of ₹1.15 crore has been made to the government treasury, the reports added. Virat's brother Vikas Kohli reportedly completed the transaction on Tuesday, the day before Ganesh Chaturthi.

131.title: There's no financial 'security' for NZ cricketers: NZ pacer McClenaghan
131.article_body: Following New Zealand cricketer Trent Boult's decision to give up his central contract, New Zealand pacer Mitchell McClenaghan said, "There's...no [financial] security at all [for our players]." "You're not an employee...You could lose your job tomorrow so...your security's out of the window," added McClenaghan. "Once you're at a certain age, you're not...valued at New Zealand Cricket," he stated.

132.title: Pictures of influencer Aashita Singh go viral, people call her Aishwarya Rai's lookalike
132.article_body: Pictures of Aashita Singh have gone viral, with several social media users calling her Aishwarya Rai's lookalike. Aashita, who describes herself as an artist in her Instagram bio, has over 2.5 lakh followers. "Looking like Aishwarya Rai," an Instagram user commented on one of her posts, while another comment read, "Aishwarya pro max."

133.title: England announce their squad for T20 World Cup 2022
133.article_body: England have announced their squad for the men's T20 World Cup 2022. The 15-member squad will be led by Jos Buttler. The team includes five players from the Yorkshire county. Further, fast bowlers Chris Woakes and Mark Wood, who last played for England in March, have recovered from their respective injuries and have been included in the squad.

134.title: Kalyan Chaubey elected new AIFF President, beats Bhaichung Bhutia 33-1
134.article_body: Former Indian footballer Kalyan Chaubey has been elected the new All India Football Federation President. He defeated Bhaichung Bhutia as general secretaries of 33 state football federations voted for him, while Bhutia received just one vote. The elections were first scheduled for December 2020 but were delayed due to multiple factors including delay in drafting the AIFF constitution.

135.title: 7-8 of our first 10 employees are still with us: Bombay Shaving Company CEO
135.article_body: Bombay Shaving Company's CEO Shantanu Deshpande told ET NOW that out of the first 10 employees, seven to eight of them are still working at the startup. Deshpande was recently criticised for advising freshers to work 18 hours a day. "Feel free to come any time," he earlier said to people wondering about the work culture at Bombay Shaving Company.

136.title: Pics show chaos, passengers' protest at Delhi airport after Lufthansa cancels flights
136.article_body: Over 700 passengers inside Delhi airport and 200 of their relatives outside Terminal-3 staged a protest late on Thursday night after German carrier Lufthansa informed it is cancelling its flights on Friday due to pilots' strike. "Two flights to Munich and Frankfurt with around 400 passengers were cancelled without intimation...Situation was diffused," police said.

137.title: 'Serial killer Stoneman' arrested after sketch released by Madhya Pradesh police
137.article_body: An assailant dubbed "Stoneman" by Madhya Pradesh police officers has been arrested after his sketch was released. The man suspected to be involved in the killings of three security guards in Sagar town was arrested from Bhopal. The deceased guards had their heads smashed in separate incidents earlier this week.

138.title: SC rejects plea to declare Sanskrit as national language
138.article_body: The Supreme Court dismissed a plea seeking to declare Sanskrit as the national language. The court said it was a policy decision which requires an amendment to the Constitution. "We cannot issue a writ to the Centre to take a particular policy decision," it added. The bench asked the petitioner, a lawyer, if he could speak one line in Sanskrit.

139.title: Armaan Kohli languishing in jail, bail order pending before HC: Lawyer
139.article_body: The lawyer of actor Armaan Kohli, who was arrested last year by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) in a drugs case, has stated that the actor is "languishing" in jail. He said that Armaan's bail order is pending before the High Court as the judge is in Nagpur. NCB officials had allegedly recovered 1.2 grams of cocaine from his residence.

140.title: Used to listen to cricket commentary under covers as a kid: Big B
140.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan on his television game show 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' has revealed that he used to go under the covers of his bed to listen to cricket commentary on the transistor as a child. He added that when his mother Teji Bachchan caught him, she questioned him and asked him to focus on his studies.

141.title: There's a difference between criticism & bullying: Erica J Fernandes
141.article_body: Actress-model Erica J Fernandes in an interview spoke about trolling faced by those in the industry, saying there is a difference between structural criticism and trolling and bullying. Erica was earlier trolled for sporting a Viking look at an award show red carpet. "It's ironic how I was getting trolled for following a theme set by the organisers," she added.

142.title: Google pledges $20 mn to boost computer science education in US
142.article_body: Google has pledged $20 million to make computer science (CS) education accessible to more than 11 million underserved students in the US. The funds will be given to organisations, including Oakland-based Hidden Genius Project, that work with major urban centers and rural communities. Google said the pledge brings its total commitment to CS education to over $240 million since 2004.

143.title: I am 'still worried' about Virat Kohli's lack of fluency: Jaffer
143.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said Team India will be in "trouble" if somebody's not batting at a strike rate of 140 or 150 alongside Kohli. "You've got to have somebody who's batting...at a much higher strike rate...I'm still worried about Kohli's fluency...If Suryakumar Yadav [hadn't fired] (against Hong Kong), India would've scored 150," added Jaffer.

144.title: Jharkhand heading towards becoming a separate Islamic nation: BJP MP
144.article_body: Amid political crisis in Jharkhand, BJP MP Nishikant Dubey claimed that the state is moving towards becoming a separate Islamic nation. "The way the pro-Pakistan forces are active, it is only the vote bank politics...The government is moving towards the creation of a new country...After Pakistan, Jharkhand will be a place which will merge with Bangladesh," said the MP.

145.title: Clashes erupt as Cong workers try to obstruct Sitharaman's convoy in T'gana
145.article_body: Youth Congress workers clashed with BJP members and the police as they tried to obstruct Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's convoy during her visit to Kamareddy district in Telangana on Friday. Workers of both parties were injured in the incident. The incident occurred during Sitharaman's visit to Zaheerabad parliamentary constituency for the BJP's Parliament Pravas Yojana.

146.title: Maruti Suzuki India reports 26% surge in total sales in August
146.article_body: Maruti Suzuki India reported a 26.37% surge in total sales at 1,65,173 units in August as against 1,30,699 units in the corresponding month last year. The domestic passenger vehicle sales saw a 30% growth, while that of the mini segment cars grew to 22,162 units as against 20,461 units in August 2021. Sales of compact cars clocked a 57% surge.

147.title: 9 arrested for looting steel rods from warehouse near Thane
147.article_body: The Mira-Bhayandar, Vasai-Virar Police have arrested nine people for allegedly stealing steel rods worth nearly ₹4 lakh from a company's warehouse on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway at Pelhar, Thane. The accused were arrested from various districts of Maharashtra and most of them are already booked in multiple cases, police said. The Mumbai Police also assisted in the operation.

148.title: Kerala shops can't sell shawarma without licence, fine up to ₹5 lakh
148.article_body: Shops in Kerala must have a licence to sell shawarma, according to the government's new rules. Those found in violation could be punished with a fine up to ₹5 lakh and imprisonment up to 6 months. As per the new rules, chicken used in the shawarma must be cooked for 15 minutes and beef for 30 minutes.

149.title: B'luru was neglected by previous govts: K'taka CM on floods in city
149.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday blamed the negligence of previous state governments for recent floods in Bengaluru. "For the past eight-ten years, Bengaluru was completely neglected," he added. He claimed that ₹800 crore, which was spent by the civic body on remodelling of drains, wasn't utilised properly and that builders have encroached upon drains in the last 15 years.

150.title: Stones hurled at houses in Ghaziabad, locals 'stop stepping out'
150.article_body: Residents have said that people have "stopped stepping out" of their homes after unidentified individuals started regularly hurling stones and other materials at houses in Ghaziabad's Ashok Nagar A block. The stone pelting reportedly began on Monday and police said that they will now use drones to trace the suspects. "Police personnel have been...[on] lookout...but are clueless," a resident said.

151.title: SC issues notice to Centre on population control plea
151.article_body: The Supreme Court issued notice to the Centre on a plea seeking direction to the government to frame rules and guidelines to tackle the overpopulation issue. The plea said that overpopulation is one of the most significant factors giving rise to several serious problems. It also sought direction to declare the first Sunday of every month as Health Day.

152.title: 2 minors electrocuted at Ganesh Chaturthi fair in Greater Noida, 1 dies
152.article_body: At least one boy, aged 12, died after he and another boy, aged three, were electrocuted at a Ganesh Chaturthi fair in Greater Noida on Thursday, police said. The victims were descending from an iron ladder after getting off a swing, police added. The two boys were on a 'train ride' when the incident happened, police stated.

153.title: Pune, Jalgaon report 10 deaths due to lumpy skin disease
153.article_body: At least 762 cases of lumpy skin disease across 10 districts in Maharashtra have been reported. Moreover, 10 deaths have been recorded due to the disease across Pune and Jalgaon districts. Owing to the rising cases, officials from the animal husbandry department have decided to ban all interstate transport of cattle, including cows and buffaloes.

154.title: Mysterious pneumonia kills three people in Argentina
154.article_body: Three people have died from a type of pneumonia of unknown origin in Argentina's Tucuman province, authorities said. Another six have been infected with the mysterious respiratory illness, Tucuman Health Minister Luis Medina Ruiz said. All the cases so far are connected to one health clinic. The medical facility has been placed in preventive isolation for seven days.

155.title: S Korea, US, Japan to respond jointly if N Korea conducts 7th nuclear test
155.article_body: The US, South Korea and Japan will respond jointly if North Korea conducts its seventh nuclear test, South Korea's National Security Adviser said after a meeting with his US and Japanese counterparts. "Our three countries together with the international community will maximise cooperation in a way that [North Korea] realises it was a clearly wrong choice," Kim Sung-han added.

156.title: I-T Dept raids Kolkata-based firm, finds ₹250 cr unaccounted income
156.article_body: The Income Tax Department had in August raided the premises of a Kolkata-based company that manufactures power transmission and distribution structures, among other things. The Finance Ministry said the raid and seizure covered 28 premises in West Bengal and Jharkhand. Various pieces of evidence related to alleged tax evasion, fraud and unaccounted income of over ₹250 crore were unearthed.

157.title: Used to listen to cricket commentary under covers as a kid: Big B
157.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan on his television game show 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' has revealed that he used to go under the covers of his bed to listen to cricket commentary on the transistor as a child. He added that when his mother Teji Bachchan caught him, she questioned him and asked him to focus on his studies.

158.title: 9 arrested for looting steel rods from warehouse near Thane
158.article_body: The Mira-Bhayandar, Vasai-Virar Police have arrested nine people for allegedly stealing steel rods worth nearly ₹4 lakh from a company's warehouse on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway at Pelhar, Thane. The accused were arrested from various districts of Maharashtra and most of them are already booked in multiple cases, police said. The Mumbai Police also assisted in the operation.

159.title: S Korea, US, Japan to respond jointly if N Korea conducts 7th nuclear test
159.article_body: The US, South Korea and Japan will respond jointly if North Korea conducts its seventh nuclear test, South Korea's National Security Adviser said after a meeting with his US and Japanese counterparts. "Our three countries together with the international community will maximise cooperation in a way that [North Korea] realises it was a clearly wrong choice," Kim Sung-han added.

160.title: There's a difference between criticism & bullying: Erica J Fernandes
160.article_body: Actress-model Erica J Fernandes in an interview spoke about trolling faced by those in the industry, saying there is a difference between structural criticism and trolling and bullying. Erica was earlier trolled for sporting a Viking look at an award show red carpet. "It's ironic how I was getting trolled for following a theme set by the organisers," she added.

161.title: I am 'still worried' about Virat Kohli's lack of fluency: Jaffer
161.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said Team India will be in "trouble" if somebody's not batting at a strike rate of 140 or 150 alongside Kohli. "You've got to have somebody who's batting...at a much higher strike rate...I'm still worried about Kohli's fluency...If Suryakumar Yadav [hadn't fired] (against Hong Kong), India would've scored 150," added Jaffer.

162.title: 7-8 of our first 10 employees are still with us: Bombay Shaving Company CEO
162.article_body: Bombay Shaving Company's CEO Shantanu Deshpande told ET NOW that out of the first 10 employees, seven to eight of them are still working at the startup. Deshpande was recently criticised for advising freshers to work 18 hours a day. "Feel free to come any time," he earlier said to people wondering about the work culture at Bombay Shaving Company.

163.title: Armaan Kohli languishing in jail, bail order pending before HC: Lawyer
163.article_body: The lawyer of actor Armaan Kohli, who was arrested last year by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) in a drugs case, has stated that the actor is "languishing" in jail. He said that Armaan's bail order is pending before the High Court as the judge is in Nagpur. NCB officials had allegedly recovered 1.2 grams of cocaine from his residence.

164.title: Stones hurled at houses in Ghaziabad, locals 'stop stepping out'
164.article_body: Residents have said that people have "stopped stepping out" of their homes after unidentified individuals started regularly hurling stones and other materials at houses in Ghaziabad's Ashok Nagar A block. The stone pelting reportedly began on Monday and police said that they will now use drones to trace the suspects. "Police personnel have been...[on] lookout...but are clueless," a resident said.

165.title: I-T Dept raids Kolkata-based firm, finds ₹250 cr unaccounted income
165.article_body: The Income Tax Department had in August raided the premises of a Kolkata-based company that manufactures power transmission and distribution structures, among other things. The Finance Ministry said the raid and seizure covered 28 premises in West Bengal and Jharkhand. Various pieces of evidence related to alleged tax evasion, fraud and unaccounted income of over ₹250 crore were unearthed.

166.title: England announce their squad for T20 World Cup 2022
166.article_body: England have announced their squad for the men's T20 World Cup 2022. The 15-member squad will be led by Jos Buttler. The team includes five players from the Yorkshire county. Further, fast bowlers Chris Woakes and Mark Wood, who last played for England in March, have recovered from their respective injuries and have been included in the squad.

167.title: Clashes erupt as Cong workers try to obstruct Sitharaman's convoy in T'gana
167.article_body: Youth Congress workers clashed with BJP members and the police as they tried to obstruct Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's convoy during her visit to Kamareddy district in Telangana on Friday. Workers of both parties were injured in the incident. The incident occurred during Sitharaman's visit to Zaheerabad parliamentary constituency for the BJP's Parliament Pravas Yojana.

168.title: Pune, Jalgaon report 10 deaths due to lumpy skin disease
168.article_body: At least 762 cases of lumpy skin disease across 10 districts in Maharashtra have been reported. Moreover, 10 deaths have been recorded due to the disease across Pune and Jalgaon districts. Owing to the rising cases, officials from the animal husbandry department have decided to ban all interstate transport of cattle, including cows and buffaloes.

169.title: Pictures of influencer Aashita Singh go viral, people call her Aishwarya Rai's lookalike
169.article_body: Pictures of Aashita Singh have gone viral, with several social media users calling her Aishwarya Rai's lookalike. Aashita, who describes herself as an artist in her Instagram bio, has over 2.5 lakh followers. "Looking like Aishwarya Rai," an Instagram user commented on one of her posts, while another comment read, "Aishwarya pro max."

170.title: 2 minors electrocuted at Ganesh Chaturthi fair in Greater Noida, 1 dies
170.article_body: At least one boy, aged 12, died after he and another boy, aged three, were electrocuted at a Ganesh Chaturthi fair in Greater Noida on Thursday, police said. The victims were descending from an iron ladder after getting off a swing, police added. The two boys were on a 'train ride' when the incident happened, police stated.

171.title: Mysterious pneumonia kills three people in Argentina
171.article_body: Three people have died from a type of pneumonia of unknown origin in Argentina's Tucuman province, authorities said. Another six have been infected with the mysterious respiratory illness, Tucuman Health Minister Luis Medina Ruiz said. All the cases so far are connected to one health clinic. The medical facility has been placed in preventive isolation for seven days.

172.title: Kalyan Chaubey elected new AIFF President, beats Bhaichung Bhutia 33-1
172.article_body: Former Indian footballer Kalyan Chaubey has been elected the new All India Football Federation President. He defeated Bhaichung Bhutia as general secretaries of 33 state football federations voted for him, while Bhutia received just one vote. The elections were first scheduled for December 2020 but were delayed due to multiple factors including delay in drafting the AIFF constitution.

173.title: Google pledges $20 mn to boost computer science education in US
173.article_body: Google has pledged $20 million to make computer science (CS) education accessible to more than 11 million underserved students in the US.
