348.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that shows a member of Raj Thackeray's MNS pushing and slapping an elderly woman in Mumbai's Kamathipura allegedly during an argument over installation of a bamboo stick in front of her shop. The man was identified as Vinod Argile. The woman fell to the ground while trying to resist a group of men.

349.title: Nagaland minister shares pic of dinner served in Rajdhani Express, Twitter users react
349.article_body: Nagaland minister Temjen Imna Along tweeted a picture of the dinner served to him in Rajdhani Express while heading to Dimapur from Guwahati and appreciated the railways. "It seems you're travelling in 1AC...I recently travelled by Bhopal Shatabdi and...[food] they served was horrible," a person wrote. "Travelled 4 times in Rajdhani...never got such elaborate meal once," another comment read.

350.title: As an outsider, one flop film can end my career: Kartik Aaryan
350.article_body: Kartik Aaryan said, as an outsider in the film industry, he is "not padded" and doesn't have his back taken care of. He said that even if one of his film flops, "it could create a perception that can end my career". He added, "I won't have someone who will create a project of that level for me."

351.title: Centre has spent 1 lakh cr on infrastructure projects in Kerala: PM
351.article_body: While addressing BJP workers in Kochi on Thursday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that the Centre has spent ₹1 lakh crore on multiple projects to develop modern infrastructure in Kerala. "The central government is working to open at least one medical college in every district...[and] to ensure basic facilities and housing for the poor and marginalised in Kerala," he added.

352.title: Maniesh Paul to make OTT debut with thriller drama
352.article_body: Maniesh Paul said he is making his OTT debut with director Ritam Srivastav's upcoming thriller drama. He said the web-series will allow him to showcase his skills as an actor and do something beyond comedy. "I cannot talk much about this web series but I am not playing a comic character and it is a very interesting role," he said.

353.title: Hindu group calls for 'Goshamahal Bandh' in Hyd over Raja Singh's arrest
353.article_body: The Sri Ram Yuva Sena has called for a 'Goshamahal Bandh' in Hyderabad to protest against the arrest of suspended BJP MLA T Raja Singh. The Preventive Detention (PD) Act was invoked against the Goshamahal MLA by the police for his derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad. In some Telangana districts, a bandh was called, which evoked mixed or no responses.

354.title: IIT Guwahati researchers develop edible coating to boost shelf life of fruits, vegetables
354.article_body: Researchers at IIT Guwahati have developed a non-toxic and edible coating to extend the shelf life of fruits and vegetables. The coating was made using a mixture of micro-algae extract and polysaccharides. "It can help preserve vegetables and fruits for as long as two months," a researcher said. The coating has been tested on potatoes, tomatoes, strawberries, apples, pineapples etc.

355.title: Am not Jesus Christ, if you hit me, I'll hit back: TN BJP chief to minister
355.article_body: Amid ongoing row between Tamil Nadu's BJP chief K Annamalai and the state's Finance Minister Palanivel Thiaga Rajan, Annamalai has said he isn't 'Jesus Christ' to turn the other cheek if insulted by the minister. "If you hit me, I'll hit back," he added. Annamalai's comments came after Rajan accused him of being "vile" and "a curse on Tamil society".

356.title: 3 farmers buy idols online, claim they 'unearthed' them from their field in UP
356.article_body: Police have taken three farmers into custody in UP's Unnao for claiming that they unearthed idols which they had bought online from Amazon for ₹169. The father and his two sons told villagers that a goddess appeared in their dream and told them to dig their field to find the idols. "They wanted to establish a temple there," police said.

357.title: Younger generation thinks wife means 'Worry Invited For Ever': Kerala High Court
357.article_body: While hearing a case pertaining to a divorce sought by a husband on the ground of matrimonial cruelty, the Kerala High Court observed that the younger generation avoids marriage to enjoy free life without liabilities and obligations. "They would expand the word 'Wife' as 'Worry Invited For Ever' substituting the old concept of 'Wise Investment For Ever'," it added.

358.title: Reliance acquires Campa, marking entry into FMCG business: Reports
358.article_body: Reliance Industries has reportedly acquired soft drink brand Campa from New Delhi-based Pure Drinks Group for an estimated amount of ₹22 crore. Moreover, RIL also acquired soft drink brand Sosyo from Surat-based Hajoori, as per reports. The acquisition of Campa would mark Reliance's entry into the FMCG business, which was announced during the company's annual general meeting on Monday.

359.title: Pune domestic workers union demands strict punishment for Seema Patra
359.article_body: Pune Zilla Gharkamgar Sanghatana, the union of Pune's domestic workers, demanded strict punishment for suspended BJP leader Seema Patra, who allegedly tortured her domestic help for eight years. The union also called for the highest possible compensation for the victim. "Patra is a member of...BJP Mahila Morcha...[This] shows what lip service the BJP pays to women's rights!" the workers said.

360.title: Man performing stunt at Ganesh Chaturthi celebration sets himself ablaze; video emerges
360.article_body: A video showing a man accidentally setting himself on fire while performing a fire-breathing stunt at a Ganesh Chaturthi celebration in Gujarat's Surat has surfaced online. The man's upper body, along with his face, was briefly engulfed in flames after he performed the stunt. He was saved after another man, who also burned his hand, removed the man's t-shirt.

361.title: Make Congress' next internal polls' rolls public: Senior leaders
361.article_body: Senior Congress leaders have demanded that the electoral rolls to elect the party's next president should be made public. Lok Sabha MPs Shashi Tharoor, Manish Tewari, Karti Chidambaram and senior leader Anand Sharma said the move will ensure transparency. "Everybody should know who can nominate and who can vote. There is nothing wrong with that," Tharoor said on the matter.

362.title: BJP worker shot dead inside a showroom in Gurugram market
362.article_body: BJP worker Sukhbir Khatana was shot dead inside a showroom at a market in Gurugram. He was attacked by four-five assailants at the store located on Gurudwara Road near Sadar Bazar.  Khatana was taken to a hospital where he succumbed to the injuries. A police investigation is underway in this case.

363.title: Suryakumar's 6-year-old 'God' tweet for Kohli resurfaces after Kohli praises him
363.article_body: India batter Suryakumar Yadav's tweet calling Virat Kohli 'God' resurfaced after the latter praised him for his knock against Hong Kong. Kohli stated he was "blown away" by Suryakumar's 68*(26). "In the big SHOES. Where there is pressure [there] is him. I [have] seen GOD walking at number 3 for India to bat," Suryakumar had tweeted in 2016.

364.title: Twitter begins testing 'Edit Tweet' feature, shares details
364.article_body: Twitter on Thursday announced it has begun testing the 'Edit Tweet' feature with its team internally, adding that its access will be expanded to Twitter Blue subscribers late this month. Twitter stated, "For the test, Tweets will be able to be edited a few times in...30 minutes following their publication. Edited Tweets will appear with an icon, timestamp, and label."

365.title: It's not survey but mini NRC: Owaisi on survey of UP madrassas
365.article_body: After the UP government announced to conduct a survey of unrecognised madrassas in the state, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said the BJP "wants to harass Muslims". Owaisi said, "Madrassas are as per Article 30 then why [UP] government has ordered the survey? It's not a survey but a mini NRC." "The state government can't interfere with our rights," he added.

366.title: Water in B'luru lakes unfit for drinking, bathing: Pollution board
366.article_body: None of the 105 lakes in Bengaluru have water fit for drinking or even bathing, the Karnataka State Pollution Control Board has said in its water quality analysis report. The waters have been contaminated by the entry of untreated sewage and industrial effluents, it added. The lake waters can be used for propagation of wildlife, fisheries and irrigation.

367.title: 7 workers of private factory consume poison over salary delay in Indore
367.article_body: Seven employees of a private factory in Indore reportedly consumed a poisonous substance to protest against delayed salaries and transfer to another establishment. They were hospitalised. According to the police, the factory owners had not paid their salaries for months and also transferred the workers to some other place, because of which they were facing a lot of problems.

368.title: Chinooks used by IAF do not have any problems: Boeing India President
368.article_body: After the US Army grounded its fleet of CH-47 helicopters, citing a risk of engine fires, Boeing India President Salil Gupte clarified that the Chinooks used by the Indian Air Force don't have any problems. "IAF contacted our engineers after incidents were reported in the US and have been informed...there's no impact on the helicopter operated by...Indian forces," he said.

369.title: Value of UPI transactions touches all-time high of ₹10.73 lakh cr in Aug
369.article_body: Value of digital payment transactions through UPI touched an all-time high of ₹10.73 lakh crore with 657 crore transactions in August 2022, according to National Payments Corporation of India's (NPCI) latest data. UPI transaction value in July was at ₹10.63 lakh crore with 628 crore transactions. UPI transaction value crossed the ₹10-lakh-crore mark for the first time in May.

370.title: Woman falls off bike as saree gets entangled in wheel, dies in Maha
370.article_body: A 22-year-old woman riding pillion on a motorbike with her husband fell off the vehicle after her saree got entangled in the rear wheel chain of the two-wheeler in Maharashtra, police said. Priti Puchul Shinde died due to severe head injuries. The accident took place on the Amravati-Nagpur Highway at Gondkhairi village of Nagpur district on Monday, police said.

371.title: Raj CM directs officials to repair roads damaged during monsoon
371.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Thursday directed officials to repair roads damaged during this monsoon. Speaking about his visit to Jodhpur, Gehlot said he found that roads in the district were damaged. "Chief engineers, additional chief engineers should conduct field visits," Gehlot said, adding a special campaign will be undertaken from September 5 to October 20 to repair damaged roads.

372.title: Not surprised by personal attacks, won't be deterred: Delhi LG on corruption allegations
372.article_body: Reacting to the allegations of corruption made against him by AAP, Delhi Lieutenant Governor V K Saxena said he won't be surprised if more such "personal" and "baseless" attacks were made against him and his family. "CM Kejriwal...in desperation has resorted to diversionary tactics and false accusations," he tweeted. "I'll under no circumstances...be deterred from constitutional duties," he added.

373.title: Inter-state drug racket busted in Hyd; drugs worth ₹9 lakh seized, 8 held
373.article_body: The Hyderabad Narcotic Enforcement Wing on Thursday said they busted an inter-state drug racket and arrested eight people in the case. The sleuths seized 140 grams of hashish, 184 blots of lysergic acid diethylamide (LSD) and 10 grams of MDMA worth ₹9 lakh, an official release said. It added that 30 drug consumers purchasing from the accused were identified.

374.title: Rajeev Sen, Charu Asopa call off their divorce; say 'We've decided to keep our marriage'
374.article_body: Rajeev Sen and Charu Asopa, who had earlier confirmed their separation, have decided to call off their divorce. Sharing a picture on Instagram, Charu wrote, "Happy to announce that we have decided to keep our marriage for good." "We both are blessed with a beautiful daughter...Her upbringing & happiness is our number one priority," she added.

375.title: Two-wheeler financing startup Bike Bazaar raises ₹170 cr in equity funding
375.article_body: As part of its on-going Series D round, two-wheeler financing startup Bike Bazaar has raised ₹170 crore in equity funding. The funding was received from a consortium led by Women's World Banking Asset Management. The firm said that it has raised more than ₹250 crore in debt financing in the last six months from banks and financial institutions.

376.title: PM to inaugurate multiple projects worth ₹3,800 cr in Karnataka
376.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi would visit Karnataka on September 2 and inaugurate various projects undertaken by New Mangalore Port Authority and Mangalore Refinery and Petrochemicals Limited, which are estimated to be worth ₹3,800 crore. Before his visit to Karnataka, PM Modi will commission India's first indigenous aircraft carrier INS Vikrant at Cochin Shipyard Limited in Kochi.

377.title: Malware uses fake Google Translate app to mine crypto on 1.12 lakh PCs: Report
377.article_body: According to a research by Check Point Research, a malware created by Turkish firm Nitrokod has reportedly been used since 2019 to mine crypto on nearly 1.12 lakh users' personal computers (PCs) without their permission. Hackers wait for a month after the app is installed to start mining crypto to ensure the user doesn't notice changes in PC's power consumption.

378.title: 16 IAS officers transferred in administrational reshuffle in UP
378.article_body: In an administrational reshuffle, Uttar Pradesh government transferred 16 IAS officers. Principal Secretary to the CM, Sanjay Prasad, will now have additional charge of the home department and information department. Navneet Kumar Sehgal has been made Additional Chief Secretary of Sports, while Parth Sarthi Sen Sharma has been appointed Principal Secretary of Health and Family Welfare Department.

379.title: Sanjiv Rangrass to be appointed to board of directors at Zetwerk
379.article_body: Business-to-business (B2B) unicorn Zetwerk will be appointing Sanjiv Rangrass to its board of directors. Rangrass is an angel investor in the contract manufacturing platform and will join as an independent director and board member, Zetwerk said in a statement. He was the former Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of ITC Ltd Agribusiness division, and was with the company for 40 years.

380.title: Hyderabad Police arrest 8 drug peddlers who used crypto as payment
380.article_body: The Hyderabad Narcotics Enforcement Wing arrested eight drug peddlers who were using cryptocurrency as payment. The drug trafficking network was operating via the Darknet and the police seized 140 grams of charas, 1450 grams of ganja, 184 LSD blots, and 10 grams of MDMA from them. "The arrests are linked to international cartels," said CV Anand, Commissioner of Police Hyderabad.

381.title: NHAI removing pipelines ahead of Chandani Chowk old bridge demolition
381.article_body: National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) and Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) started the work of removing pipelines above Pune's Chandani Chowk overpass on Wednesday. The pipelines installed around the chowk include water supply pipelines and electricity service lines, among others. They're being removed as the old bridge at the chowk will be demolished between September 12-15, officials said.

382.title: Salman Khan's 'Bigg Boss 16' to premiere in October: Reports
382.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 16' makers have reportedly locked the premiere date of its upcoming season. The makers of the Salman Khan-hosted reality show are reportedly planning to lock either October 8 or October 9 for Bigg Boss 16's premiere. Earlier, the new season was supposed to launch on October 1, but the makers decided to push it for a week.

383.title: 8 booked for 'hookah, non-veg boat party' on river Ganga in UP's Prayagraj
383.article_body: Police have booked eight persons after a video showing a group of youth smoking hookah and roasting chicken on a boat on river Ganga in Prayagraj went viral on social media. In a statement, the police said a case, charging two named accused and six unidentified people for hurting religious sentiments and defiling a place of worship, has been filed.

384.title: Lufthansa to cancel almost all flights on Friday from 2 German cities amid strike
384.article_body: German airline Lufthansa has said that it will cancel almost all passenger and cargo flights on Friday from Frankfurt and Munich amid a wage dispute. The pilots' union Vereinigung Cockpit demanded 5.5% pay raise this year for more than 5,000 pilots. However, the union's spokesperson said, "We have not received a sufficient offer...this is sobering and a missed opportunity."

385.title: Riteish, Genelia buy BMW iX electric car worth around ₹1.43 crore
385.article_body: Actor Riteish Deshmukh and his wife Genelia Deshmukh bought BMW iX electric car on Ganesh Chaturthi. The two, along with their kids Riaan and Rahyl, were seen arriving at Arpita Khan Sharma and Aayush Sharma's house in their new car, which costs around ₹1.43 crore. The new model is the first-ever all-electric variant of the iX.

386.title: Bengaluru students win Smart India Hackathon, 2022
386.article_body: Bengaluru students have won the finale of Smart India Hackathon (SIH), 2022, held in Mumbai last week. The winning team is from CMR Institute of Technology. They developed a mobile application and site to help farmers select which crop to grow based on water availability. 'Water availability-based crop-specific advisory' was the competition's problem statement given by Union Jal Shakti Ministry.

387.title: 2 JeM terrorists killed in encounter in J&K, 1 civilian injured
387.article_body: Two Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorists were killed in an encounter with security forces in the Sopore area of J&K, police said on Thursday. The encounter reportedly broke out on Wednesday night after the security forces launched a cordon-and-search operation. The terrorists were reportedly planning attacks on civilians in Sopore area. Notably, a civilian also suffered injuries in the exchange of fire.

388.title: Car runs over labourers sleeping at bus stand in Thane; 4 injured
388.article_body: A speeding car allegedly ran over four labourers sleeping at a bus stand, injuring them in Thane on Wednesday. According to police, the labourers, aged between 30 and 60, were sleeping on a pavement near the canteen when the incident happened. Others who were sleeping there woke up and rushed the labourers to a hospital where they are undergoing treatment.

389.title: Don't eff this up: Bezos recalls warning from son for Lord of Rings' prequel
389.article_body: Ahead of the debut of The Lord of the Rings' prequel 'Rings of Power' on Amazon's Prime Video, Jeff Bezos revealed a conversation he had with his son. He said, "My son came up to me one day, he looked me in the eyes, very sincerely, and he said: 'Dad, please don't eff this up'...And he was right."

390.title: Rahul's 36, Kohli's fifty, Jadeja's bowling, all positives from India vs HK: Irfan
390.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said KL Rahul's 36-run innings, Virat Kohli's half-century, Suryakumar Yadav's batting and Ravindra Jadeja's bowling were some of the positives from India's Asia Cup match against Hong Kong. "Kohli's half-century is the biggest positive because of the way he batted...You see the score but we here see how he played...he [was] in control," added Irfan.

391.title: 2 electrocuted, 3 injured during Ganesh Chaturthi procession in Tamil Nadu
391.article_body: Two people were electrocuted to death and three suffered injuries during a Ganesh Chaturthi procession in Tamil Nadu's Virudhunagar district. The incident occurred at around 10:30 pm on Wednesday after the chariot came in contact with an electric transformer at Sokanathan Puthur. Those injured are undergoing treatment at Government Hospital in Sivagiri, District Collector J Meghanath Reddy said.

392.title: EU mulls over capping energy prices, cutting electricity demand
392.article_body: The European Commission is looking into measures to cap energy prices and cut electricity demand, Mechthild Wörsdörfer, Deputy Director General of the European Commission's energy department said. She mentioned that European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen will outline ideas on capping energy prices on September 14. Russia had cut gas deliveries to Europe which led to rise in prices.

393.title: Employment rate among youth at 5-year low: BJP MP Varun Gandhi
393.article_body: Citing the CMIE data, BJP MP Varun Gandhi said the employment rate among youth is at a five-year low. "Employment rate among youth has come down from 20.9% to 10.4%," Varun Gandhi tweeted. "Recently, PM urged all the departments to fill up 10 lakh posts lying vacant but till now, no department could formulate a concrete action plan," he added.

394.title: 134 artificial ponds created for immersion of Ganesh idols in Navi Mumbai
394.article_body:
The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) has created 134 artificial ponds for immersion of Ganesh idols. NMMC chief Abhijit Bangar inspected a few sites to check the arrangements and 
directed municipal officials to physically inspect natural and artificial immersion sites. In addition to the artificial ponds, there are 22 natural ponds where devotees can immerse idols.

395.title: Paytm transaction of ₹100 leads Delhi police to accused in ₹4 cr heist
395.article_body: A Paytm transaction of ₹100 led to the arrest of four suspects in a robbery case of a jewellery consignment worth ₹4 crore in Delhi. Police had found that one of the accused took ₹100 from a cab driver after transferring him the money digitally. Delhi police approached the Paytm headquarters, got his number and subsequently, arrested the accused persons.

396.title: Assamese drug peddler held in K'taka's Madikeri, drugs worth ₹50,000 seized
396.article_body: Police in Karnataka's Kodagu district on Wednesday arrested an Assamese man for selling marijuana and seized drugs worth ₹50,000 from him. "Madikeri Rural Police has arrested an Assamese man...at...Chettalli village under Madikeri rural police station," Kodagu SP tweeted. This comes after the district police busted a drug peddling racket on Tuesday and seized drugs worth ₹10 lakh.

397.title: Jharkhand ruling alliance delegation meets Governor amid CM disqualification row
397.article_body: Amid the row of Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren's disqualification as an MLA, the ruling Jharkhand Mukti Morcha-Congress alliance delegation on Thursday met Governor Ramesh Bais. This comes after the Election Commission reportedly recommended the disqualification of the CM to the Governor. Soren is accused of violating electoral law by extending a mining lease to himself.

398.title: We asked reason, there was no bitterness: Cong's Hooda on Azad’s resignation
398.article_body: Congress' Bhupinder Singh Hooda, while speaking about a meeting held earlier with Ghulam Nabi Azad, said, "Party presidential polls are taking place. Still, he decided to quit. We asked him reason...there was no bitterness." Furthermore, he said, "We had been in same party for years and we had put forth some demands. Those demands were accepted."

399.title: Delhi court acquits man, his parents in dowry death case, says 'taunting not cruelty'
399.article_body: A Delhi court has acquitted a man and his parents in a dowry death case, saying that "the usual acts of taunting within the fabric of a family do not become cruelty". They were accused of subjecting the woman to cruelty that prompted her to die by suicide. The court said the testimony of the deceased's mother was "shaky".

400.title: Working with Ranbir, Big B in 'Brahmastra' was dream come true: Soni
400.article_body: Actor Markand Soni said working with actors Ranbir Kapoor and Amitabh Bachchan was a "100%" dream come true. "I've never met someone as kind and as sweet as Ranbir Kapoor and Amitabh Bachchan sir," he added. Soni further called them grounded. '''Brahmastra' is going to be like something you have never seen before in the Hindi film industry," he added.

401.title: Films with bad scripts get rejected, I'm one of the victims: Chiranjeevi
401.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi said the number of people coming to theatres has gone down after the pandemic. However, he added people will come if the film's script is good. "The bad films get rejected on the second day of their release. I'm one of the victims of this trend," he added. Chiranjeevi's 'Acharya' failed to perform at the box office.

402.title: HS Prannoy defeats ex-world champion to enter Japan Open quarterfinals
402.article_body: Shuttler HS Prannoy has entered the quarterfinals of the ongoing Japan Open Super 750 tournament after defeating 2021 men's singles world champion Loh Kean Yew of Singapore. Prannoy won with a scoreline of 22-20, 21-19 in a 44-minute second-round match. The 30-year-old Indian will next face Chinese Taipei's Chou Tien Chen in the last-eight stage.

403.title: Water in all Bengaluru lakes unfit for drinking: KSPCB report
403.article_body: According to a water quality analysis report by Karnataka State Pollution Control Board (KSPCB), out of the 105 lakes in Bengaluru, not a single lake is fit to be a drinking water source. Entry of untreated sewage and industrial effluents into them remain the major reasons behind the contamination of these water bodies, the report said.
